item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Plaxico Burress, former New York Giants receiver, indicted on weapons charge but Antonio Pierce not indicted
item.description: Plaxico Burress was indicted by a Manhattan grand jury investigating a gun charge against the former New York Giants wide receiver. Former teammate Antonio Pierce was not indicted.

item.dc:creator: Chris Low
item.title: Florida Gators make Urban Meyer highest paid in SEC with 6-year, $24 million deal
item.description: Urban Meyer, who has taken the Florida Gators to rarified heights with two national championships in four seasons, will see his salary climb to equally exclusive company.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Edinson Volquez, Cincinnati Reds pitcher, has Tommy John surgery
item.description: Cincinnati Reds right-hander Edinson Volquez underwent elbow ligament-replacement surgery Monday and is expected to miss approximately 12 months, the team said.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Philadelphia Eagles middle linebacker Stewart Bradley likely to miss season with torn ACL
item.description: Eagles middle linebacker Stewart Bradley will likely miss the season with a torn ACL, a source told ESPN 950 in Philadelphia.

item.dc:creator: James Walker
item.title: Carson Palmer, of Cincinnati Bengals, returns to practice
item.description: After a two-day hiatus, Cincinnati Bengals starting quarterback Carson Palmer rejoined his team at training camp and participated in Cincinnati's Monday morning practice.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Pedro Martinez of Philadelphia Phillies works on stretch delivery in bullpen session
item.description: Pedro Martinez threw 53 pitches in a bullpen session Sunday in an effort to smooth out some delivery issues from the stretch.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Ferrari's Felipe Massa leaves hospital in Hungary, headed home to Brazil
item.description: Ferrari driver Felipe Massa is on his way home to Brazil, nine days after a life-threatening crash during qualifying at the Hungarian Grand Prix.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Nevada Supreme Court to hear O.J. Simpson appeal
item.description: Lawyers for O.J. Simpson and a former golfing buddy hope to persuade a Nevada Supreme Court panel to spring the two men from prison while the justices review their convictions in a gunpoint hotel room heist.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Boston Red Sox fired 2 staffers in steroid probe
item.description: A Boston newspaper is reporting the Red Sox fired two security staffers last summer after an investigation into steroid use.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Buick Open: Tiger Woods earns 69th career Tour win
item.description: Tiger Woods shot a 69 Sunday and coasted to a three-shot victory with a 20-under 268 at the Buick Open for the 69th PGA Tour title of his career.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: World championships: Michael Phelps' 400 medley relay team ends worlds with record
item.description: Michael Phelps and the U.S. 400-meter medley relay team closed the fastest meet in swimming history with an appropriate finish Sunday night -- the 43rd world record.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Arizona Cardinals RB Beanie Wells sidelined with sprained ankle
item.description: Beanie Wells has a sprained ankle that could sideline him for the short term, Arizona Cardinals coach Ken Whisenhunt told the team's Web site Sunday.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Shoulder surgery for Arizona Diamondbacks Brandon Webb
item.description: Diamondbacks ace Brandon Webb will have season-ending shoulder surgery.
